summary: Rani, a 24-year-old homely girl, decides to go on her honeymoon alone when her fiancé calls off the wedding. Traveling around Europe, she finds joy, makes friends, and gains new-found independence.

reviews.content: "Queen" is a unique movie that will warm your heart and will keep you interested throughout the journey. I think the lead performance is what makes this movie stand out and what makes it so memorable. The movie does have some slow patches but as a whole, it is very entertaining. It isn't a typical Bollywood movie and is something different for sure.
This film was funny haah

Perhaps for domestic viewers it doesn't really show, but when you transfer a very controlled Bollywood style and set the film in a very familiar European setting the two work against each other in terms of character, culture and the sincerity of the story.
In an ideal world, every Hindi film would star Kangana Ranaut :)
highlights a woman's realisation that she cane break free from the cultural constraints of a traditional Indian upbringing
fantastic film, proof that there are talented actors and directors in South Asia who are not afraid of stepping out of the comfort zone
Refreshingly different !

Rani, a simple old-fashioned Delhi girl with a devotion to Ganesh gives in to a worldly Londoner/Delhi boy who over time convinces her that marriage is a good idea, and then says "sorry, let's be friends" the day before the wedding. This is when good/interesting/crazy things happen for Rani. Thoroughly enjoyed the whole story. It might have had some typical Bollywood moments, but these movies are growing on me for the plain and simple entertainment value.
Ain't nothing like a good Bollywood movie to feel good. Great!!!

With the known fact of Kangana's acting being absolutely sublime, the movie does teach one a few lessons; there are some mistakes never to be made again.. Sometimes I do believe that if people start avenging issues this way, where would the spirit of mercy go?? But then, leaving one's life partner at the alter is not something one can do without suffering for it..

Queen... Had an excellent way of celebrating Women's day today by watching Queen movie. Mr. RG, Women empowerment are not cliche words for interviews. Just watch this movie before your next interview. Kangana Ranaut is so naturally simple!!! And each and every actor has acted superbly irrespective of the screen time. Ladies, please do a favor to urself and watch this gem of a movie.

My fav scenes:
- Of course the dance in the pub
- In the beginning of the movie, boy dumps the girl in a restaurant. Similar scene in the climax, but with the roles reversed
- The level of detailing is too good. Notice how the mehendi on Kangana's hands is faded in the climax scenes. Brilliant
- When Kangana is in an awkward situation, her male friend comes and asks HER, do u need help... does not automatically assume that she needs help. Fantastic!
- The Pani poori scene and the Emraan Hashmi reference.
- The end credits showing Kangana's trip as Facebook timeline. How logical!

-ve points:
- Some scenes are intelligently inspired from English Vinglish
- The hero's reason for dumpling is not convincing enough

My rating:
Story - 0.5 - nothing new
Screenplay - 1 (The arc of Kangana's transformation is so smooth)
Acting - 1 (Even the kid brother has acted well)
Other departments - 0.5 (I expected more from Amit Trivedi specially since he sets such a high bar for himself after English Vinglish and Lootera)
Overall Package - 1

Total - 4/5
Decently grounded in reality for a Bollywood film. Enjoyable coming of age movie. A few strange parts and plot points that go nowhere, but solid movie overall.
A wonderful story of finding independence and discovering how to be comfortable in your own skin.
Kangana was perfect!

I can't believe I saw a Bollywood movie that lasted over 140 minutes and there was not one song and dance number.  Really, not one.  The beginning, when the family is celebrating Rani's impending wedding, does not count as it is a family partying.  It's not meant to move the story forward in any way.  It must take a great amount of self-restraint.  I think that's where the positives end to be honest.  Then again, there's like 10+ music montage scenes here, so that's an adequate substitute.  This movie is definitely well-intentioned, seeing the story of a simple woman who, upon being dumped by her fiancee, decides to go on her honeymoon by herself, wherein she discovers her zest for life.  It's as corny as it sounds and it's just, honestly, not a very good movie.  It's more like a series of sketches where Rani gets herself into silly situations, a typical fish-out-of-water concept, and how her very conservative upbringing makes her react when she sees the lifestyle some the friends she meets on her journey lead.  I will say one thing, and I guess this is a positive, and that is that the lead of this film, Kangana Ranaut, is immensely likable.  I'd say that the Rani character is a bit of a muppet, but I think Kangana does a decent enough job at not letting the character become someone you pity.  The story is, essentially, nonexistent.  It's all about Rani liberating herself and becoming a new woman.  That's all fine and good.  But the movie is, as I mentioned, slightly over 140 minutes long.  You need a lot more than Rani just having a good time with people she meets in Paris or Amsterdam.  That's what the movie boils down to.  It's all Rani having a good time.  And that's fine if you're a real person wanting to just have a blast to forget a particularly nasty breakup.  It's not so necessarily fine when you're in a fictional movie that's super fucking long.  You need far more content than the film was willing to provide here.  They were hoping that Kangana being so charming and likable would go a longer way than it ended up going.  One thing I will say that's a positive, and that's not even anything having to do with the film, is that I think this movie has one of the most stunningly beautiful women I've seen in a long time.  Lisa Haydon plays Vijay, the person she meets in Paris and becomes friends with.  Let's just get this out of the way, she was a terrible actress.  She was just horrendous.  But she was quite gorgeous.  And it's not like it hit you all at once how gorgeous she actually was.  She got more and more beautiful the more you kept seeing her.  It was something else.  While her character was a little bit wild and out there, and as mentioned, she was terrible, but there's a certain something about the way she carries herself.  She's got some great presence.  Your eyes are immediately drawn to her no matter what scene she is in.  She, quite frankly, overshadows Rani.  Smartly enough, Rani leaves Paris to go to Amsterdam, so the female Vijay couldn't overshadow her anymore.  Honestly, once Rani finds herself in Amsterdam, this is when the movie hits its "stride".  There's some cute stuff there with Rani, staying at a hostel with 3 men, and how her conservative upbringing has made her weary of this situation and how her family would react.  It's not good, but at least it's something.  And, at the very least, Rani isn't overshadowed by her three roommates.  Of course, Rani builds somewhat of an unbreakable bond with her three roommates in five days.  It feels a little too quick to me, but that's how the movie presented it.  There's also not much to the stuff in Amsterdam honestly.  It's more of the same, Rani having a good time with her friends, smiling a lot and actually having us pretend that that's good storytelling.  Look, this movie looks like it was a lot of fun to shoot.  It must have been like a vacation for the majority of the actors, they have minimal stuff to do if you really think about it.  It's an easy, breezy, light-comedy.  Ok, but just because the characters are having fun does not mean that we are as well.  I guess seeing the reaction among flixster users, at least scoring-wise, as there's one negative review, means that most people did enjoy it.  I just don't see it to be honest.  The film gives off the appearance of being fun and enjoyable.  But that's all it is, an illusion.  And it's a sweet film in parts, like I honestly believe the film meant well, but good intentions can only take you so far.  I wouldn't say it's bad, I'd just say that there should've been more effort to tell a good story instead of relying, mostly, on stereotypical cliches.  Kangana Ranaut is fine and Lisa Haydon is gorgeous, but there's nothing of substance to this film.

Charming low-budget surprise hit about an innocent Delhi girl whose fiancée cancels their wedding at the last minute. She takes the honeymoon trip by herself and cluelessly wanders through Paris and Amsterdam, making new friends and discovering herself. Many funny moments, some overly long scenes, a fresh performance by Kangana Ranaut, and the usual bad casting of foreigners' roles. Not one of Amit Trivedi's strongest soundtracks (too European).

Had to watch this after national award thing and all, well brilliant stuff from Kangana..but the movie is very similar to  "The Art of Travel (2008)" American Indie drama OR "Honeymoon for one(2011)" ...but yeah never mind its considered original here.

Great thanks for Vikas Bahl i finally can add another movie to the favorite movies list.

If i wanted to sum up every thing i adore in this movie i will not end until Mr.Bahl does his next film which i believe will be marvelous as this one.
As you know there's a lot of things that makes the movie a good one in other words a big hit like how good was the acting and how the shooting was and all this details but what matters the most in my opinion is the idea of the movie itself, i think the idea is the thing that makes the movie a really good movie, So that's why i can say that this movie is an extraordinary movie because i loved the idea so much.
The idea is about a girl who was shy, afraid,controlled,satisfied with her little world. And shockingly she got betrayed from her fiancee who canceled their weeding. But with the help of strangers from totally another countries who became her new friends in addition from the help of her free self in other words without being protected all the time from the close ones,she changed to a whole new other person who is independent, strong, open-minded and courage women, because in my opinion she finally knew that she doesn't need anyone to feel happy and not being protected caused her a new experiences and new lovely people... a whole new life, also she finally tried new things. So i can sum up all this by saying she explored the world within herself.

So if anyone ever ask someone which character in a any film would you be? I know that most of the girls would pick the beautiful character with the perfect body and the perfect boyfriend but if they ask me i would pick queen because i want to be the girl she turned out to be: a beautiful, confident, open minded, courage girl satisfied with own self.

Thanks again Vikas Bahl.

Tempted to give it another half star, but eh. 
Just a plain fun movie to watch. Flashback scenes were very well done. Quirky story with even quirkier characters. Great acting all around.
Funny, delightful, charming, fun and inspiring!
It's a really sweet, charming, and sophisticated movie.
Kangana Ranaut was born to play this role. Brilliant acting from start to finish.
Fabulous and refreshing Hindi movie. Kangana had done a superb job and very good direction too. A good mix of humour and emotion.

Turned out to be of quite a different genre than what I was expecting. Even otherwise, I wasn't having any high expectations of enjoying it. Completed it within less than 1 hr. 15 min. of which there were hardly a very, very, very few entertaining moments.
a flashback of my exchange life
Awesome movie. Kansans is brilliant n Lisa Hayden is wow
A charmer with a good heart and healthy dose of escapism.

There are very few movies that can make you feel good, make you laugh, emotional and make you think about it. Queen can do it to you successively at the same time. Kangana Ranaut was always considered an average actress, but after Queen it has been proved that she is the queen of all actresses in acting. This is the performance that has never seen before by an bollywood actress and she has carried the whole movie on her shoulder. But this doesn't mean there is nothing except Kangana in this movie, the storyline is different and really interesting as well. Vikas has narrated the story in a delightful way. Music enhances the quality of movie and goes very well with the mood of movie. All and all Queen will be remembered as a landmark movie for bollywood as well as world cinema.
?

The only thing that holds the whole movie is Kangna's SURPRISINGLY nice performance,which never goes over the top UNLIKE most of the other characters in the movie :P
Overall, a message well sent, breaking the stereotypes & portraying how an Indian woman is not at all 'weak' & kudos to that spirit of the movie

I watched the Lunchbox not long time ago and quite like it. That's why
I give Queen a try. Totally disappointed. The supporting actors and
actress are like amateurs. The plot is painfully predictable. The jokes
are not funny at all. The only time I really laughed is when I saw that
bras are censored in the movie! (The scene in the bathroom.)
Charming..Interesting...& Fun
Surprisingly good...
Amazing' comedy and funny
"Pure trash but it's entertaining as hell."
Woman emotion centered movie done right. Though boring in some parts it is very good to watch.
Truly a great Bollywood movie.
Loved the music, movie not so much
Sweet and heartwarming. Another proof that quality work doesn't need big names attached to it. Kangana Ranaut is really the queen here. What a charismatic performance.
GREAT Acting by Kangna. This is a non-stop entertainer, great story and acting by all. And at the end she choose right.
Just average. Doesn't justify the high ratings

The movie gives a fresh feeling to feminism and friendship with subtle but impressive acting from the main character.the supporting actors also play their parts In a pretty calm way..the whole movie makes you feel the moments and actually keeps your dream that one day anybody can backpack through Europe .there are no clichéd dialogues or scenes as often sees in indian movies.
A must-watch! its such a beautiful and inspiring story of self discovery. Well-Done, Kangana Ã°???
One of the best movies where the girl ventures on her own to a whole new place in a foreign land.
Loved every bit of this movie and understood every moment.

Definitely one of the better movies to come out of Bollywood in recent times. Simple yet charming story along with powerful performances especially from  kangana. With an amazing soundtrack this one is highly recommended.

Perfect ! Films like this should produce more, theres touch of bliss and life. Queen is a legendary term though! In real life every girl is a queen to her own kingdom, to her parents , siblings. Life is not something make serious fun... to play for entertainment. No such people deserve a second chance who consider their partner only how they want. If you love someone you should want him/her what S/he really is, don't try to change him/her completely according your desire. Thats pretty unfair. 
Queen shows it and proves it.

Queen showcases Kangana Ranaut's spectacular and terrific performance. A movie with less words, and zero melodrama. The movie begins with the loud Punjabi Wedding - mehandi, sangeet celebrations of Rani aka Queen (played by Kangana Ranaut). It is great to see Rani's self-talk as a bride-in-making about lot many things viz. her friend ought to be dancing in her mehandi, young kid brother Chintu ought to be taking photographs of her on her mobile etc. Devastated by the last minute 'call off' of the relationship by her fiancée London-returned Vijay Dhingra (Rajkummar Rao), she decides to fly (with her family' support) for her pre-planned honeymoon all alone to Paris and Amsterdam. Here Rani starts her voyage of self-discovery, a girl from Rajouri Garden of Delhi, over protective daughter of a Mithaiwala (businessman) to a foreign land absolutely on her own. It is really wonderful to see Rani emerge from her turmoil.
Director Vikas Bahl has done a great job by weaving a very ordinary theme into a great story of triumph of an ordinary girl, regaining her self-esteem, and relooking at life from a very different perspective. Vikas is not at all judgmental in projecting the east and west lifestyles.  
Lisa Haydon as Vijayalakshmi (called as Vijay), a Hotel staff in Paris and French-Indian single mom, who turned to be a good friend of Rani has done full justice to her role. Vikas Bahl has thoughtfully crafted two 'Vijay' in the movie, one by Rajkummar Rao and another by Lisa Haydon, one responsible for the 'miseries' (can we say so...?) in Rani's life, and another showing her a different path to her independent and self-worthy life.
From Paris, Rani goes to Amsterdam where she gets the company of multi-cultural trio: White, Black and Asian. Certain scenes are just hilarious. Rani is absolutely shown on her way to learn freedom, friendship, togetherness, yet skyping with her family in India ten times a day.  
The cast of Rani's family- her parents, dadi and brother are all very good. Rajkummar Rao as Vijay has given a great performance as a regular obnoxious boy who wants a girl (who should not be working, yet modern in looks) within his framework. He excels in almost all the frames: in his efforts to persuade Rani for his love, then rejecting her, and also as the one who wants to win back the girl and her love when he finds that she has started fitting into his so-called 'parameters'. 
The beauty of the film is all about the gradual unexaggerated transformation of Rani along with the fading of Mehandi on her hands into a confident self-assured girl. Rani tells us that is it necessary to be victim to someone else's deeds, someone else's rejection ? There is a beautiful scene in the movie that soon after cancellation of the marriage and crying for almost the whole night, she gets up and eats the same Shaadi ke Laddu which was kept in her room.
Yes, the Queen completely belongs to Kangana, her silent, yet great facial expressions, her innocence, her carrying off kurtis to beautiful stylish costumes. Absolutely natural look is given to her. 
Music by Amit Trivedi is doing good in chartbusters. Paris and Amsterdam have been captured nicely by the cinematographer.

Watch Queen, she is going to be the queen of your heart.
one of the best bollywood has ever shown...
Subtly bold and entertaining

Kangana is super good with no makeup & her cool composed self as the girl next door. Apart from her the film can be a slow drag at points with some fun laughs thrown in. Decently good direction & really good music makes this one of the good films out this Spring.
In the top 3 bollywood movies for 2014
A strong story and message yet light-hearted..thats what I think is good movie making!

Day: Tuesday
Date: 8 Apr 2014
Time: 9.30 pm
With: Maa 
On: HDTV

With hopes of a big celebration, Rani's preparations involve the London thumka and a complete emotional and mental surrender to the dream of an ideal wedding. Her world is shattered by her fiance who chickened out of the wedding on grounds that Rani didn't evolve to his now foreign lifestyle. The distraught and heart-broken Rani comes out from a brief self imprisonment to her concerned family and seeks permission to escape to Europe on her own for a solitary honeymoon and to find solace from the anguish. 

	The Hungama begins in Paris as she struggles independently in a foreign land. The despondent Rani who cannot cross the street, order normal food or even find peace in the city of lovers, meets Vijayalaxmi (Lisa Hayden) who is the antithesis of a conservative Indian girl. This scantily clad hotel housekeeper gradually exposes Rani to a free spirited living where every moment is fun-filled and made of carefree choices. Rani enjoys the company of her new friend and is almost past her failed engagement when her next move takes her to Amsterdam in a hostel room shared with 3 guys. The initial hesitation and fear is soon converted to a genuine bond of friendship as these roommates have fun around town. Language is a bit of an issue especially with Rani but she knows how to take a joke on herself. This uncanny ability turns even the most awkward moment into a laughable memory. 
In the company of such unusual, warm, funny and trust-worthy friends, Rani lets go of the inhibitions she was brought up with and discovered freedom that had no strings attached. The resulting confidence was a handy weapon to use when she was suddenly confronted by her now apologetic betrayer, Vijay. Rani has found her true self in the company of these strangers in a foreign land while on the other hand, an opportunity to fix the ignominy of a failed wedding ceremony rests before her. She doesn't have to follow the conventional norms anymore. With her freedom comes the right to make her own decisions and she shall be the Queen of her own fate. 

	With the charming 'Chillar Party', Vikas Bahl portrayed his penchant for feel-good comedies. Queen isn't really challenging society's norms but it is proving yet again that society doesn't have the right to dictate the path for an individual. Within an open environment, a person can find their path and face challenges with renewed confidence. Rani is the embodiment of a simpleton's free-spirited nature and while she violates Guptaji's principles, she doesn't cease to entertain in this journey of self-discovery. Kangana Ranaut's exemplary performance is owed to her ability to naturally become Rani. Her ability to laugh at herself no matter how awkward the situation, is a particularly striking attribute that makes her so loveable. Kangana excels in some scenes where the simpleton Rani emotes naturally. With a few drinks on a night out, Rani helplessly bursts into tears and whines about her life 'itna kharab ho gaya' and soon she erupts on the dance floor to rock to Hungama hogaya and goes wild on the streets. She is deeply rooted to her conservative culture but does not mind trying some of Vijayalaxmi's open and free ways. Rani grows out of the broken relationship and by the time she mingles with her roommates in Amsterdam, she is a fun-loving, carefree individual who has found her peace among friends. This transition is handled by Kangana with a naturally subtle performance. The roommates Tim, Taka and Olexander are also fine actors with a keen ability to portray their characters in a natural manner. Taka is so full of energy while Olexander provides an understanding of Rani's traits and becomes a support for her. The rest of the supporting cast including Rajkumar Rao as Vijay and Rani's parents have provided sincere performances to suit the mood each time. 

	Hungama hogaya is definitely the most suited and entertaining song from the soundtrack. London Thumka starts off the entertainment during the Mehendi event. Badra Bahar is also a fun track that revolves around Rani's initial times in Paris. O Gujariya is Rani's transition into a fun-loving bride-to-be whereas Jugni and Kinare offer more depth in their lyrics to convey Rani's emotions and the story's implications. Amit Trivedi impresses yet again after his shot to fame with Wake up Sid, Udaan, Ek main aur ek tu, Kai po Che and Lootera. 

	Rani's solitary honeymoon turns out to be quite an adventure rather than a lonely, sulky escape. The screenwriters and dialogue writers have done very well with a story that wasn't supposed to provide depth and intricacy. Rather, Bahl's focus is maintained in the primary character and her relationships with strangers in a foreign land. It's Rani's vacation that is the focus and her transition is only a side-effect of all the fun she has away from home. Queen is thoroughly enjoyable in every aspect with Kangana's ground-breaking performance at its core. Vikas Bahl has brought meaning to a simple story with soulful music by Amit Trivedi, sharp editing, witty dialogues and genuine performances by the supporting cast. This Rani will win your heart and you will only be too glad to lose it. 

	- 9.115 on a scale of 1-10.

One of the best films of the year. It is a coming of age drama filled with the excitement, humour and realization of life in it's entirety.
Fresh. Original. Well acted. Extremely well written. A must watch.

Flooded with charismatic performance by Kangana, since her debut in Gangster (2006) Queen is beautiful Europe travelogue of sweet girl with a broken heart.  For me its like The Shaw shank Redemption.  Beautiful and heartwarming.
Different, clean, sensible movie.  Kangana is wonderful.   Accurate portrayals of conversations and expectations in india and Europe.

the movie is about how a girl who could not even burp at her own home with all those restrictions girls have in india started fooling around and making new freinds with oodles of confidence in the streets of paris

well to be honest went to watch it twice and both the times i left it in the 1st half an hour because i finded it a bit boring and then finally watched it at home on a friend's suggestion and thank god i did

well the movie is about a behenji kinda delhi girl dating a self proclaimed cool and modern guy who calls off their wedding just a day before because he felt emabaressed marrying that girl basically...till then the plot is a bit slow and boring(atleast to me) and then the girl all of a sudden from that shock wants to go to her honeymoon in france as they planned BUT alone and then the movie takes off to another level with hints of comedy,innocence,love and everything else(except sex but ofcourse)

must watch if you scream and yell for women empowerment all the time else a decent watch still none the less
A movie that seriously rocks both your world (alongside all the stupid stereotypes of the society) !!

Do you enjoy an underdog story?...a Comeback story? The kinda movie that has lines that go "Its about how much you can get hit and keep moving forward...." then this movie is for you. Queen is the story of Rani (Queen from the title) and how she overcomes her emotional barriers in an effort to become a true Queen of herself. The plot is simple and the acting is spot on (especially by Kangna Ranaut). The plot is as tight as Lisa Haydon's abs and the viewer is never left to wander about by her/himself. The movie really makes you realize that sometimes innocence does lead you to better things in life and therefore it is precious to hold onto it.
LOVED IT! Lisa Haydon was mighty impressive!

this movie kinda hits on the point of any indian girl  who might think getting married is the penultimate choice of life, its definitely a deeper chick flick for those who might have gone through the same situation in their love life, self motivation was the entire mantra throughout the movie, its hard to grasp reality when ones fairy tale comes to a halt but for our own growth we search the one person who has been there all this time patiently watching our life and thats us in a realistic and happy mode.
Women centric nice story. Good acting. Worth a watch
a decent movie story wise, but it is the performance of kangana ranaut that makes it a worthy watch. somehow it feels different and better than other hindi movies that had similar themes.

Apart from Kangana's organic performance & Vikas Bahl's great direction, its Amit Trivedi's flawless music that takes this film to an entirely new level specially when movie seems to be slow. This is easily Kangana's career best performance even surpassing her act in Woh Lamhe. She is believable as naive & innocent Delhi girl while Rajkumar as self centered bastard makes you hate him & that's his biggest compliment. While other supporting cast also manages to put a smile on your face. More importantly comedy is subtle & Bahl explores the rare genre of self discovery in foreign land superbly. BY far the most feel good film in recent times.
Perfect comedy timing, Kangana Ranaut is brilliant as usual. You'll love the movie & Kangana's character! #Bollywood #movies

Women empowerment on the rise.. a good one after English Vinglish.. with a much global approach..and as these two movies suggest.. women have to step out of India for sure to get empowered.. 'coz at home nothing and no-one will let you..
Lovely movie. Every Indian woman (and man) should watch it. Young women will learn to speak and act for themselves. A story sensitively told.

This is a film that strikes more than one false note, particularly in its characterizations.  The selfish jerk who dumps the girl is almost one-dimensionally selfish and jerky. Then, in what seems like a needless attempt to strike the Quirky Indie Dramedy note, we have unlikely characters like the Indian prostitute in Amsterdam who speaks perfect Urdu and is seemingly from a loving, well-to-do family. (She has apparently taken up the world's oldest profession as a temporary job to tide over the recession. Ugh.) Also, the non-Indian characters in the film sometimes veer into caricature. 

Yet, all this adds up to one of the most sincere and heartfelt Hindi movies I have ever seen, and that is almost entirely due to a stunning performance by Kangana Ranaut. A lesser actress would have taken the simple, sweet, vulnerable Rani and turned her into a naive, cloying, emo nightmare. In Kangana's hands, she might well become an iconic heroine in Hindi cinema. It's too bad our award shows are a farce, because this is a landmark performance that truly deserves some real recognition. Credit must go to the director and screenwriters as well. It is so refreshing to see a role written for a woman where her sole object is not to acquire or assist a man.

A delightful movie with unexpected, taboo-breaking twists and turns at every corner. The underlying message is socially critical and radical. Its highly unconventional delivery is somehow still kept light and understated. Kanika is smashing. An array of foreigners are also given substantial, heart-warming and racially untainted roles in a way never seen previously in Hindi movies.
this is has be one of THE most Fabulously made films about self-discovery and creation of one's self-worth! and Kangana Ranaut is a true revelation. Watch this one. you will not regret it!

Queen is a gem of a film!!Kangana Ranaut delivers a performance that marks her light years ahead of any of her contemporaries. She conveys most through her pitch-perfect body language. And even in her dialogues she gets the right tonality for it all. 'Queen' might be the birth of a legend and thank God for that!  Rajkumar Rao & a variety of co stars provide great support to her. 'Queen' is easily one of the most accomplished films made in a long time. The skillful direction of Vikas and Kangana's easy virtuoso makes this one an indulgent affair.

God oh God! Why do I bother to watch such commercial Bollywood films? Everytime, some people convince me, forget the rest, THIS ONE is good. And i'm like, okay, let's see. Everytime, I cringe in my seat as the actor or actress acts as if I am seeing a school production, check the time on my watch as another random song breaks onscreen and yawn incessantly as the direction is banal and cliche. Why can't Indian mainstream directors be more thoughtful? Why do they have to DUMB DOWN everything? Why are these movies so boring? Can we then blame our movie going audience to be like, "Accha, paanch minute hi to miss kiya hai, kya ho jayega?" or talk on the phone or talk to your neighbour about politics?
Acting was so hyped before. It was really not professional enough. Ancillary acting was pathetic to say the least.
ughhhhh

Brilliant Movie. Quite a surprise for a Bollywood Movie as its very different form your main stream movies. It's realistic/social movie having a female lead and still ends up being a entertainer. It has quite a lot of dance & music which are actually good and fits in perfectly with the flow of the story. There is humor and it's not the cheesy/stupid kind. Amazing Directing and Writing skill to make it feel so real. Kangana Ranaut & Lisa Haydon give performances of there life time. The character growth of Kagana Ranaut is refreshing and a must watch.

All the relatives, infused with the joy of celebration, dancing around the bride-to-be Rani (means 'Queen' in English), who is getting her hands patterned (mehendi) as she excitedly talks about the marriage and her fiancé. From the very first glimpse we get of her (played by Kangana Ranaut), the innocence and naivety of this simple non-urban middle-class girl pierces through you, and you're hooked to her life right then. She is bound to get hurt, and that's what happens when her wannabe London-returned lover comes back and dumps her the day before the marriage. Heartbroken, she decides to go ahead with the honeymoon plan, for a break from everything. And this trip, through Paris and Amsterdam, proves to be a journey of self-discovery for her; she goes through her grief with the help of four varied and interesting people she befriends along the way, lives a little, and finally finds the importance of independence; it's about taking the reins of her life into her hands, and actually become the Queen of it. In a country where more than half of the women are forced to assess their lives by the men (most of them worthless) they marry, this movie is an uplifting tribute to women who gained their independence.

All the varied characters and situations in the movie have something to offer. The movie abounds in clichés - the free-spirited half-Indian single mother, the Muslim girl working at the strip club to cover family expenses, the good-looking and proud Italian chef, and the Indian Food ('golguppa') sale in a Foreign Fair - but all these are proficiently used to contribute something or the other to the characters and their stories, and that's what allows me to excuse or overlook them. There are moments which almost make you fall off the seat laughing, and there are others which make your eyes fill up. 'Queen' doesn't lag for a single moment; it's engaging and entertaining from beginning till the end of credits (yes!).

And the leading lady Kangana Ranaut is the main reason why this movie is a triumph. Having no make-up on for majority of the film, Kangana charms her way through with her varied range of emotions and expressions, and terrific acting skills. I've always liked her work, but with this movie, I'm in awe of her. She gets tremendous support from the various talented actors who portray the supporting characters commendably. Especially Lisa Hayden, who is charming as the sultry waitress/ party-going girl and has a heart of gold. Everyone is aware of her exotic looks, but whoa, she can act well too.

After co-directing the simple yet delightful 'Chillar Party' three years ago, this can be called Vikas Bahl's debut as a solo Director; he has co-written the script too. The skillful treatment of various themes, the proper development of the characters, the unbiased balance maintained between the Native and Foreign settings - all this is accredited to the brilliant Director. Already being associated with last year's best (among Hindi films), 'Lootera', and churning out an exhilarating movie like this, Bahl seems to have a good taste; I really look forward to his future work.

The crisp editing, the tasteful cinematography, and Amit Trivedi's appropriately-timed remarkable music score help create the overall masterpiece it is.

(Rani) Getting drunk and dancing beside a random stranger on the street, sharing a Santa-Banta "non-veg" joke with her Russian friend and bragging about her sense of humour, innocently buying gifts for her family at a Sex Accessory Shop, are just few of the scenes from an incredibly memorable movie.

Life is filled with pain and humour; to know, when to cry and when to laugh, helps you sail through it (life) smoothly. 'Queen' is a celebration of that fact, and is a heart-breaking yet heart-warming piece of Cinema!

This movie is aptly titled and it's release is perfectly timed on the eve of Women's Day, as it ably shows the inner strength and conviction of a very mediocre woman, who uses the stab of severe rejection, not to bleed into the state of utter depression filled with society imposed guilt, but to expand her horizon, and in the process learns a great deal about different lifestyles & cultures, makes myriad friends, proves her self worth and tastes the state of utter freedom (both by body and mind)! 

Though this journey of hers is hesitantly supported by her loving parents and kid brother, the carefree attitude and occasional mischievous 'been there, done that' glances thrown by her grandmother are something to watch out for. In a society like ours, usually an elderly woman expectantly appears so dedicated towards her spouse and family, that it seems impossible that her delicate heart ever nursed a feeling for any other man. But life has never been this simple for them. Due to unavoidable circumstances, shyness, fear, or even betterment, many of them did nurse a feeling for someone in the past, but ended up marrying someone else altogether! And since amongst themselves they do understand this, breakup of an impending marriage, is not that much of a hoo-haa for them, as much as they expectantly portray it to be. They do know that it is unacceptable but not unthinkable. And when it happens to their own blood, they do have the wisdom and conviction to make their granddaughters see the matter in a sensible light and pave their way. 

Rani (literally meaning 'queen'), the protagonist is a girl-next-door, who is wooed over by a family friend's son, Vijay (Rajkummar Rao) into marriage. On the eve of the marriage, he breaks it up on the pretext of lifestyle and attitude difference that has widened between them due to his London based job and stay! After spending a night in extreme shock and tears, Rani decides to regain the control of her life by starting with going alone on her honeymoon trip (Paris and Amsterdam)! And in this trip, out of her comfort zone, she discovers a whole new different world, wherein all her past taboos seem right, and quite a few right notions seem wrong. She learns - to trust and enjoy the company of good strangers, to fight for herself, the taste of independence and success, and mostly the difference between so called right actions and right intent.

Kangana Ranaut has done a fantastic acting job. Her approach towards the role is very fresh and natural. With her history of living-on-the-edge glam roles, this one comes as a pleasant surprise. Her Indianisation started with 'Tanu Weds Manu' and she has come full circle with 'Queen'. Rajkummar Rao has expectantly done a brilliant job. Lisa Haydon is another surprise package in the film. Her natural uninhibited form with French accent is again something to watch out for. Mish Boyko, Jeffrey Ho, Joseph Guitobh, Canadea Lopez Marco who have played Kangana's roommates/associates in Amsterdam have also essayed their roles with great naturalness and ease. The child artist who plays Kangana's sibling appears convincing as a possessive kid brother. Rest of the cast has also performed well.

Special applause needs to be given to the director, Vikas Bahl to present well and in perfect harmony, two very different sensibilities, one that of a middle class conservative Indian, and the other of an international traveler. He has also well captured the dilemma of the protagonist while making the consistent cross over between these two sensibilities. When using foreign locales and 100% foreign actors with the protagonist actor as Indian, very few movies are able to portray the true essence of the script. Hats off to the director, that this is one such movie.

I saw the movie this morning and since then I have had a constant smile on my face.

Queen follows the story of the Delhi girl Rani from Rajouri area, and probably one of the best things about the movie was the portrayal of the people living there. The people were very relatable in the sense that we all have that one relative/friend who behaves in the given manner. Even the simple Roohafza bottle at the dinner table scene made me feel so at home I felt I could smell the food.

The soundtrack was excellent, and the songs are relevant to the moment, and do not include any unnecessary mass synchronized choreographed dances.

While the script has a couple of small weak moments, the good moments are so good that we can gleefully ignore the few problems. The growth of Rani in the movie feels organic as she goes on a journey of self actualization. Kudos to the director/writer Vikas Bahl for not falling in the cliché trap by  keeping Rani single and happy at the end of the movie, instead of showing that her happiness would have depended on her marrying the 'right' guy! 

The Indianisms in the movie were handled with a very good taste with light hearted fun at the expense of the Indian Rishtedaari (family) system. Small things like Rani's email address "happyrani@yahoo.com", or the not so French Indian French Toast won me over.

Overall, I believe that Rani is a must watch for everyone, and especially to the Delhiwallas, you are going to have a lot of fun! :D

The music is sheer bliss to ears. Amit Trivedi lent a third dimension to the film. Kangana's performance was an absolute delight. I felt that I'm watching a character not an actress. I think that's the biggest compliment for an actress. Being slow at times the direction is brilliant. A woman's journey of self-discovery couldn't have been portrayed any better than this.

Class act from Kangana and she makes you root for Rani from the word go...Lisa Haydon is a revelation...Kudos to Vikas Bahl...
This is 2014's English-Vinglish...

What do u do if u r heart-broken? Be sad, stay alone, cry, watch/listen sad songs...there is another way...live your life...explore new places, explore urself. The hero of the movie is Kangana. No words for her performance. Very simple but powerful. Nice story, good screen play. Showed the typical Indian way of doing things. The glamour was added by Lisa Haydon, she looked super sexy and also acted really well. You have to bought the DVD to check the French dialog. A must watch.
Watched a flawless Hindi film almost after half a year...just Brilliant!!!

With a title like Queen and a female lead, it could have been a non-bearable chick flick. But Thank God it wasn't a girlie movie.
Kudos to the filmmakers who decides to make a feature film on a low self esteemed, under confident Indian girl as the protagonist. And cheers to Kangana who made this simple story into a delightful watch.
Awesome movie. Enjoyed every minute of it!!

Rani (kangna) hails from a middle class Punjabi family in Delhi and when she is spotted by Vijay (rajkumar) who hails from London, it is love at first sight. He wooes her to the fullest and finally Rani agrees and marriage is set. But just at the eleventh hour, Vijay comes from London only to call it off. Everyone is shattered including Rani but she decides to have her honeymoon at Paris and Amsterdam, on her own. What happens from there forms the rest.

The director has come up with an interesting storyline and while the presentation was rich, the narrative was  amazing. The dialogues were well written. The script was different and the screenplay made it gel perfectly one screen.The background score was melodious and three songs were worth watching. Cinematography was the main strength to this film. Editing was crisp. Costumes were well designed to suit the characters while the art department was natural. Kangna Ranaut carried the film very responsibly and she delivered her best. Lisa Haydon was not just smoking hot but also confident in her act. Rajkumar Rao was impressive, he scored well. Mish Boyko was worth mentioning, Jeffrey was entertaining, Guitobh Joseph was good.

Coming up with rom-coms is one thing but including them with some offbeat concepts is something else. It can be seen in this one and at the same time, the makers are tapping the women audience with such subjects. The first half goes on a lighter mode with elements of entertainment, some romance. The interval bang was promising and the second half has its own share of fun and emotional highs. Overall, this is a film which appeals due to the class audience.The films performances are rich, the direction amazing, and when it comes to women centric films, Queen is pathbreaking creating a new genre in hindi films. A must watch!!!

Queen defies every cliche, every set formula of hindi cinema, builds strong characters that do not fit in stereotype moulds for a change and comes out as an original, entertaining film that for once focusses on individuality rather than taking the usual safe route of conformity. Believe me, you do not want to miss out on a film that begs to differ... I personally was never fond of Kangana Ranaut as an actor but here she is a revealation. Lisa Haydon gives a memorable performance too...

Kangna Renaut has always been a mysterious actor. She has a tremendous potential, but something was really not on track for her both on & off screen. Thankfully Queen will change all that. She is all set to reign. Vikas Behl strikes all the right chords with Queen.. well almost.. Barring a very few dull moments, Queen succeeds majorly because it has a soul. The script is pretty straight forward, but the way Kangna carries the entire movie on her shoulders, is incredible. And some on-your-face scenes reflect the Indian male-dominant society so well. Take for example. "Humare yahan na ladkiyon ko dakaar lena allowed nahi hai" or "Beta shadi ke baad jab ye baap-bete office chale jayenge, hum log itna enjoy karenge, chai banayenge, magazine padhenge, kitty party jayenge". It may not end up earning a lot, but it will always be a very important film. It could have been perfect with a tighter script and a better usage of songs, but yes, Hungama hone do.. Also, you won't see many films where each and every scene has the protagonist in it. You will definitely bring Rani with you while coming out of the theatres. Good going, Bollywood!

Fabulous!!! A movie that will surprise you with its freshness and originality with every step.Thanks to a remarkably crisp and sophisticated screenplay and infectiously lively dialogues also written byKangana Ranaut, is like a wonderful puff of fresh air.And what a Queen Kangana Ranaut makes! Whoever knew that this often underrated actress had such enormous reserves of talent? She makes every scene come right out of screen...there are so many of those scenes which reflect the attitude of a pure indian woman and the small nuances which I might add excellently played by kangna  keep that upside curve on your face throughout. Kangana's is the heart and soul of Queen and she does not strike a single false note. 
If you have a slow weekend and you really want to end in a peppy note, I highly recommend you go watch it...and I promise you will not even stand up when the end credits start rolling over, cos there is a very FRESH surprise hidden for you... all in teh "FACEBOOK" style...

not for a single second was i able to take my eyes off kangana...........she is flowing poetry. Pure and serene. Also situational music by amit trivedi is peppy and makes you realise the importance of that song at that particular scene. Must watch.
A coming of age story done as a funny, musical and quirky travelogue... Kangana carries the film and shines as never before...
Must watch film!! Full of laughs

To be very honest first time when I saw the trailer of queen, I thought it's gonna be a flop but omg I was so wrong, queen is a surprise and full on entertainment, I wasn't bored even for a second, it's really funny and all actors were great specially leading lady just nailed it. Definitely worth watching if your looking for a good time.
Brilliant movie!! Awesome performance by Kangana!!!
Kangna's best so far...! movie's timing is perfect..!
A must watch :) Great music, brilliant acting and a very good storyline! :)

If there is a shred of fair play and honesty in the film awards business, then Kangana Ranaut should win every single award for Best actress in the coming year.

What a movie and what a fantastic performance by this lady who has been poked fun at, often, due to her lisp and accent. How she has maintained a studied silence and hot back at all her critics through her work is an example worth emulating in all walks of life.

The basic story is a theme that has been done a few times earlier but never quite as well or as engaging as this one.

The main credit has got to go to Vikas Bahl, in  his first solo director film (He was co director of Chillar Party), the screenplay writers ( Chaitally Parmar and Parveez Shaikh), the dialogue writers (Anvita Dutt and Kangana Ranaut) and of course, the star of the show - Kangana Ranaut.

Her expressions, her innocence, her sincerity, her reactions to situations (the bag snatching scene and the first night in the hotel as well as hostel scene) are so natural, that you would think that this was real life being played out in front of you.

She is very ably supported by Lisa Haydon who is outstanding in her all too brief role of the first friend that Rani makes on her solo honeymoon trip.

Much as I would like to say that Rajkumar was excellent, he was clearly overshadowed by the trio of Rani's hostel friends played by Jeffrey Chee Eng Ho (Taka), Mish Boyko (Oliksander aka Sikander!) and Marco Canadea (Marcello). The bonding and fun times shared by these 4 is heart warming and its so sad when they have to go their separate ways..........

I am urging, no, actually ORDERING you to go and watch this movie as soon as you possibly can, you will thank me for it!!!! I am hoping and praying that this one makes it to the 100.....150....200 crore club, because this is one movie that truly deserves that kind of success!!!!!
